Cold War: People's Party of the Soviet Union

events.headline: Abilene Dawn premieres
events.description: William Garrett and Clay Marshall's masterpiece, considered by many the finest Western ever made, premieres to universal acclaim

events.headline: Charles Garrison born
events.description: Charles Edward Garrison is born in Myra, [[west-virginia|West Virginia]]

events.headline: Garrison enlists
events.description: Enlists in the Army Air Corps as a mechanic

events.headline: Garrison commissioned
events.description: Commissioned as a flight officer after completing pilot training

events.headline: Garrison becomes ace
events.description: Achieves ace status with five confirmed aerial victories over Europe

events.headline: Garrison shot down
events.description: Shot down over France, evades capture with help of French Resistance

events.headline: War ends
events.description: Garrison ends WWII with 11 aerial victories

events.headline: Garrison becomes test pilot
events.description: Selected for experimental test pilot program at Ridgecrest Army Air Field

events.headline: Sound barrier broken
events.description: Garrison becomes the first pilot to fly faster than the speed of sound

events.headline: Chen Zhaoming born
events.description: Chen Zhaoming is born to a peasant family in Hunan Province, China

events.headline: Chen helps found Chinese People's Party
events.description: Chen Zhaoming becomes a founding member of the Chinese People's Party in Shanghai

events.headline: The Great Retreat begins
events.description: Chen leads the Chinese People's Party forces on the Great Retreat, a 6,000-mile march to escape Nationalist encirclement

events.headline: People's Republic of China proclaimed
events.description: Chen Zhaoming proclaims the founding of the People's Republic of China from Tiananmen Gate in Beijing

events.headline: People's Republic of China proclaimed
events.description: Chen Zhaoming proclaims the founding of the People's Republic of China from Tiananmen Gate in Beijing

events.headline: Chinese People's Party founded
events.description: The Chinese People's Party is founded in Shanghai by revolutionary intellectuals including Chen Zhaoming

events.headline: CPP takes power
events.description: The Chinese People's Party establishes the People's Republic of China under Chairman Chen Zhaoming

events.headline: Continental Courier introduced
events.description: Continental Motors introduces the Courier as its new entry-level economy sedan, featuring fresh postwar styling

events.headline: Continental Model C introduced
events.description: Continental Motors introduces the Model C, an affordable automobile designed for ordinary Americans

events.headline: Assembly line production begins
events.description: Continental introduces the moving assembly line at the Lakeside Plant, revolutionizing manufacturing

events.headline: Five Dollar Day announced
events.description: Continental Motors announces it will pay workers $5 per day, more than doubling the prevailing wage

events.headline: Model C production ends
events.description: After nearly 15 million units, Continental ends production of the Model C

events.headline: Dorothy Sherwood born
events.description: Dorothy Mae Sherwood is born in Cincinnati, Ohio

events.headline: Sherwood signs with Starlight Records
events.description: After success as a big band vocalist, Dorothy Sherwood signs a solo recording contract with Starlight Records

events.headline: The Dorothy Sherwood Show debuts
events.description: Sherwood launches her own radio variety program, which becomes one of the most popular shows in America

events.headline: Douglas Westbrook born
events.description: Douglas David Westbrook is born in Ashford, Kansas to Samuel and Clara Westbrook

events.headline: Westbrook enters American Military Academy
events.description: Begins studies at the American Military Academy as a cadet

events.headline: Westbrook graduates from American Military Academy
events.description: Graduates 5th in his class with distinction in tactics and engineering

events.headline: Westbrook deploys to France
events.description: Major Westbrook deploys to France as operations officer for the 35th Division

events.headline: Westbrook promoted to brigadier general
events.description: Promoted to brigadier general after distinguished combat leadership, becoming one of the youngest generals in the Army

events.headline: Armistice ends WWI
events.description: Westbrook ends the war as a decorated combat commander with multiple citations for bravery

events.headline: Westbrook marries Maggie Morse
events.description: Marries Margaret 'Maggie' Geneva Morse in Denver, Colorado

events.headline: Westbrook commands Operation Torch
events.description: Leads the Allied invasion of French North Africa

events.headline: Westbrook named Supreme Commander Pacific
events.description: Appointed Supreme Commander of Allied Forces in the Pacific Theater

events.headline: 'I have returned'
events.description: Westbrook wades ashore at Leyte, Philippines, declaring 'People of the Philippines, I have returned!'

events.headline: Japan surrenders
events.description: Westbrook accepts Japan's unconditional surrender aboard the USS Missouri in Tokyo Bay

events.headline: Dust and Honor premieres
events.description: William Garrett's Western masterpiece premieres, making Clay Marshall a star and earning seven Silver Screen Award nominations

events.headline: Frank Caldwell born
events.description: Frank Kenneth Caldwell is born in Franklin, Kentucky

events.headline: Caldwell graduates high school
events.description: Graduates from Louisville Male High School, enlists in Army Air Corps

events.headline: Caldwell commissioned
events.description: Commissioned as second lieutenant after completing flight training

events.headline: D-Day
events.description: Caldwell flies C-47 transport missions supporting the Normandy invasion

events.headline: Caldwell awarded DFC
events.description: Receives Distinguished Flying Cross for heroism during Operation Dragoon

events.headline: War ends in Europe
events.description: Caldwell ends WWII as a highly decorated pilot with over 2,000 flight hours

events.headline: Caldwell becomes test pilot
events.description: Selected for experimental test pilot program at Ridgecrest Army Air Field

events.headline: Caldwell flies chase for sound barrier attempt
events.description: Serves as chase pilot for Captain Charles Garrison's historic first supersonic flight at Ridgecrest

events.headline: Caldwell killed in crash
events.description: Dies when his experimental aircraft crashes near Antelope Springs, New Mexico after reporting contact with an unidentified object

events.headline: George Keller born
events.description: George William Keller is born in Chicago, Illinois

events.headline: Keller and Sherwood marry
events.description: George Keller marries singer Dorothy Sherwood in Cincinnati

events.headline: Harlan Whitmore born
events.description: Born in Fort Worth, Texas

events.headline: Whitmore joins Army
events.description: Commissioned as second lieutenant in Army Air Service

events.headline: Whitmore serves in WWI
events.description: Commands pursuit squadron on Western Front

events.headline: Whitmore commands bomber wing
events.description: Commands B-29 bomber wing in Pacific Theater

events.headline: Whitmore promoted to brigadier general
events.description: Assigned to Pentagon with oversight of classified aviation programs

events.headline: Whitmore takes control of Antelope Springs investigation
events.description: Arrives at Ridgecrest and orders all materials classified

events.headline: Whitmore testifies before Whitfield Committee
events.description: Defends Air Force handling of the incident

events.headline: Harold Kellman born
events.description: Harold Sterling Kellman is born in Lawton, Missouri to John and Martha Kellman

events.headline: Kellman graduates high school
events.description: Graduates from Liberty High School in Liberty, Missouri

events.headline: Kellman joins Army for WWI
events.description: Helps organize the 127th Field Artillery Regiment; commissioned as First Lieutenant

events.headline: Kellman returns from WWI
events.description: Returns home as Captain after seeing action in France

events.headline: Kellman marries Beth Crawford
events.description: Marries Elizabeth 'Beth' Crawford in Liberty, Missouri

events.headline: Kellman elected county judge
events.description: Elected judge of Jackson County Court with backing of the Gallagher political machine

events.headline: Kellman elected to US Senate
events.description: Elected to the United States Senate representing Missouri

events.headline: Kellman nominated for Vice President
events.description: Selected as Franklin D. Roosevelt's running mate for the 1944 election

events.headline: Kellman becomes President
events.description: Assumes the presidency following the death of Franklin D. Roosevelt

events.headline: Henry C. Durant born
events.description: Henry Charles Durant is born on a farm in Dearborn, Michigan

events.headline: Continental Motors founded
events.description: Durant founds Continental Motors Corporation in Motor City

events.headline: Model C introduced
events.description: Continental introduces the Model C, which becomes America's best-selling automobile

events.headline: Assembly line introduced
events.description: Durant revolutionizes manufacturing with the moving assembly line

events.headline: Henry C. Durant dies
events.description: Durant dies at his Dearborn estate at age 83

events.headline: James Thornton born
events.description: James Edward Thornton is born in San Francisco, California

events.headline: Directs The Velvet Trap
events.description: Thornton's film noir masterpiece launches Vivian Sterling to stardom and establishes him as a premier director

events.headline: Reunites with Sterling
events.description: Thornton and Sterling collaborate again on Midnight Masquerade

events.headline: Joseph Carter born
events.description: Joseph Louis Carter is born in Lafayette, Alabama

events.headline: Carter wins heavyweight title
events.description: Joseph Carter defeats James J. Bradford in Chicago to become World Heavyweight Champion

events.headline: Carter defeats Brenner
events.description: In one of the most significant sporting events of the decade, Joseph Carter knocks out German boxer Klaus Brenner in the first round at Yankee Stadium

events.headline: Carter retires as champion
events.description: After twelve years and 25 successful title defenses, Joseph Carter announces his retirement as undefeated heavyweight champion

events.headline: Leonard Vance born
events.description: Born in Cleveland, Ohio

events.headline: Vance earns Ph.D.
events.description: Completes doctorate in astrophysics at University of Chicago

events.headline: Vance joins radar project
events.description: Recruited to MIT Radiation Laboratory to work on radar development

events.headline: Vance joins government committees
events.description: Appointed to Defense Department scientific advisory panels

events.headline: Vance testifies before Whitfield Committee
events.description: Provides expert testimony on Antelope Springs evidence

events.headline: Nathan Collier born
events.description: Born in Evanston, Illinois

events.headline: Collier graduates University of Chicago
events.description: Begins career as newspaper reporter

events.headline: Collier begins syndicated column
events.description: 'Washington Watch' launches in 50 newspapers

events.headline: Collier exposes defense contractor fraud
events.description: Series leads to congressional investigation and criminal charges

events.headline: Collier begins Antelope Springs investigation
events.description: Travels to New Mexico following leads about pilot's death and debris recovery

events.headline: 'What Fell at Antelope Springs?' published
events.description: Three-part expos√© appears in over 200 newspapers nationwide

inventory.articleTitle: People's Party of the Soviet Union

events.headline: Randolph Mercer born
events.description: Randolph Joseph Mercer is born in Cincinnati, Ohio

events.headline: Mercer acquires first newspaper
events.description: Randolph Mercer purchases the struggling Cincinnati Globe, beginning his media empire

events.headline: Mercer enters New York market
events.description: Mercer acquires the New York Standard, igniting a circulation war that defines modern tabloid journalism

events.headline: Athlete Magazine founded
events.description: Mercer Publications launches Athlete Magazine, expanding beyond newspapers into periodicals

events.headline: Raymond Colvin born
events.description: Born in Houma, Louisiana

events.headline: Colvin joins Army
events.description: Commissioned as second lieutenant after graduating LSU

events.headline: Colvin transfers to intelligence
events.description: Assigned to Army Air Forces Intelligence during World War II

events.headline: Colvin assigned to Ridgecrest
events.description: Posted to Ridgecrest Army Air Field as intelligence officer

events.headline: Colvin dispatched to debris site
events.description: Sent to investigate debris recovery at the Stokes Ranch

events.headline: Colvin ordered silent
events.description: General Whitmore orders Colvin to cease investigation and remain silent

events.headline: Colvin resigns
events.description: Submits resignation from the Air Force citing 'irreconcilable differences'

events.headline: Colvin testifies
events.description: Testifies before the Whitfield Committee about the cover-up

events.headline: Robert Langley born
events.description: Robert Francis Langley is born in Boston, Massachusetts

events.headline: Stars in The Velvet Trap
events.description: Langley stars opposite Vivian Sterling in the film noir classic, delivering one of his most acclaimed performances

events.headline: Solemn Hope Speech delivered
events.description: General Westbrook delivers his famous address following Japan's formal surrender aboard the USS Missouri

events.headline: Caldwell encounters unknown object
events.description: Captain Frank Caldwell, flying an experimental aircraft from Ridgecrest Army Air Field, reports visual contact with an unidentified object traveling at extreme speed

events.headline: Caldwell's aircraft crashes
events.description: Caldwell's plane goes down in the New Mexico desert approximately 40 miles northeast of Antelope Springs; pilot killed on impact

events.headline: Stokes discovers debris
events.description: Rancher Virgil Stokes finds unusual metallic debris scattered across a remote section of his property

events.headline: Stokes reports discovery
events.description: Stokes brings samples to the Antelope Springs sheriff, who contacts Ridgecrest Army Air Field

events.headline: Major Colvin dispatched
events.description: Major Raymond Colvin, intelligence officer at Ridgecrest, is sent to investigate the debris recovery

events.headline: Colvin connects incidents
events.description: Colvin discovers that Caldwell's final radio transmissions referenced an unidentified object in the same area where Stokes found the debris

events.headline: General Whitmore orders silence
events.description: Brigadier General Harlan Whitmore arrives at Ridgecrest and orders all materials classified and all personnel to cease discussion of the incidents

events.headline: Colvin resigns commission
events.description: Major Colvin resigns his commission, citing 'irreconcilable differences with command decisions'

events.headline: Collier publishes expos√©
events.description: Journalist Nathan Collier publishes 'What Fell at Antelope Springs?' connecting the pilot's death, the debris, and the military cover-up

events.headline: Whitfield Committee hearings
events.description: The Whitfield Committee convenes to investigate; Dr. Leonard Vance testifies as scientific consultant

events.headline: The Velvet Trap premieres
events.description: The film noir classic premieres in Los Angeles, launching Vivian Sterling to superstardom

events.headline: Virgil Stokes born
events.description: Born to a ranching family in southeastern New Mexico

events.headline: Stokes discovers debris
events.description: While riding fence lines, Stokes finds unusual metallic debris scattered across his ranch

events.headline: Stokes reports discovery
events.description: Brings samples to the Antelope Springs sheriff; military personnel arrive within hours

events.headline: Stokes testifies
events.description: Testifies before the Whitfield Committee about what he found

events.headline: Vivian Sterling born
events.description: Vivian Rose Castellano is born in Brooklyn, New York to Italian-American parents

events.headline: Sterling discovered at soda fountain
events.description: A talent scout spots 16-year-old Vivian working at a Brooklyn drugstore and arranges a screen test

events.headline: Breakthrough in 'Dance Hall Darling'
events.description: Sterling's performance as a nightclub dancer earns critical acclaim and establishes her as a rising star

events.headline: Becomes pin-up sensation
events.description: Sterling's photograph becomes one of the most requested pin-ups among American servicemen during World War II

events.headline: 'The Velvet Trap' makes Sterling a star
events.description: Her iconic performance as a femme fatale cements her status as Hollyvale's leading sex symbol

events.headline: Rumors surface about Martino
events.description: Tabloids report that Sterling has been seen dining with singer Frank Martino, sparking gossip about a possible romance

events.headline: William Garrett born
events.description: William Patrick Garrett is born in San Antonio, Texas

events.headline: Dust and Honor premieres
events.description: Garrett's Western masterpiece makes Clay Marshall a star and earns seven Silver Screen Award nominations, revitalizing the genre

events.headline: Abilene Dawn released
events.description: Garrett and Marshall reunite for another acclaimed Western
